contextId.information: The intensity of the king's anger is spoken of as if it was a fire that burned inside him. AT: "his rage was as intense as a fire inside him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The word "eyes" refers to his sight and is a metaphor for his evaluation of her. This can be stated in active form. AT: "he was pleased with her" or "he approved of her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she received approval in his eyes

contextId.information: "Find favor" is an idiom that means be approved of or that he is pleased with her. "In the eyes of the king" is a metaphor representing his evaluation. AT: "if the king evaluates me and approves" or "if the king is pleased with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: if I have found favor in the eyes of the king

contextId.information: Restraining himself represents refusing to do something that he wanted very much to do. Haman wanted to show Mordecai that he was very angry. AT: "Haman refused to show how angry he was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The heart represents the thoughts and attitudes. AT: "thought" or "said to himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

They spoke as if Haman and Mordecai were in a battle, and Haman was beginning to lose the battle. Here "to fall" represents being dishonored and defeated. AT: "who has already humiliated you ... he will certainly defeat you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: before whom you have begun to fall ... you will certainly fall before him

contextId.information: The metaphor "being sold" represents being betrayed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "For someone has betrayed us" or "For someone has put us in danger of our enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here seeing represents realizing or understanding. AT: "He realized that disaster was being decided" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He saw that disaster was being decided

contextId.information: "In your sight" is a metaphor representing his evaluation. AT: "and if you evaluate me and I please you" or "if you are pleased with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: and I am pleasing in your eyes

contextId.information: Possible meanings are that 1) having light is a metaphor for being happy. AT: "were happy and glad" or 2) having light is  metaphor for feeling prosperous and safe. AT: "felt safe and were glad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Reaching places represents going to places. AT: "wherever the king's men took his decree" or "wherever the king's decree was read" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Fear falling on people represents people becoming very afraid. AT: "they had become very afraid of the Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the fear of the Jews had fallen on them

contextId.information: "the situation was reversed." The situation being reversed is a metaphor meaning that the opposite of what was expected happened. AT: "the opposite happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Fear falling on people represents people becoming very afraid. AT: "all the peoples had become very afraid of the Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the fear of them had fallen on all the peoples

contextId.information: Fear falling on people represents people becoming afraid. AT: "they had become afraid of Mordecai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the fear of Mordecai had fallen on them

contextId.information: Fame spreading through places represents people in those places learning about how great he was. AT: "throughout the provinces people learned about how great he was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: his fame spread throughout all the provinces

contextId.information: The word brothers represents people who were like him. AT: "fellow Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Seeking something is a metaphor for working hard for something. The abstract noun "welfare" can be translated as a phrase with the verb "prosper" or the adjective "secure"  AT: "He worked hard so his people would prosper" or "He worked hard so his people would be secure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he sought the welfare of his people
